de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline

Class ThroughputMeasurer

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.filters.AbstractFilter
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.pipeline.ThroughputMeasurer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    NetworkDataSink, NetworkDataSource

    public class ThroughputMeasurer
extends AbstractFilter
    This AbstractFilter subclass forwards incoming data without changes, but measures how often it receives data.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private RingBuffer<java.lang.Integer> mDataThroughputStorage
      The storage used for storing data throughput counts for different time spans
      private int mThroughputCounter
      Incremented whenever a new point comes in, and reset once per block
      private java.util.Timer mThroughputTimer
      Timer used for resetting the throughput measurement after each measurement block

        public ThroughputMeasurer(long blockLength,
                          int averageSize)
        Create a new ThroughputMeasurer.
        Parameters:
        blockLength - how long a block is (ms)
        averageSize - how many blocks are used to average over

    • Method Detail

      • onData

        public void onData(NetworkDevice origin,
                   SensorData data,
                   float userSensitivity)
        Forward data unchanged, only counting the events
        Parameters:
        origin - the device that sent the data
        data - the data that was sent
        userSensitivity - the sensitivity the user set for this sensor type

      • getThroughput

        public float getThroughput()
        Returns the measured throughput
        Returns:
        sum of packages received in the blocks divided by the amount of blocks
